fields.description:
Resolves a particular field of an object (e.g. o.some.random.field). It
will also check if this object is part is part of a cycle as indicated by
context's `cycle` attribute and what to do about it as indicated by
context's `cycle_default` attribute. If SKIP then the spec returns NONE
indicating the spec should be ignored otherwise a ValueError is raised.

`name`
    The name of the field to pull off the object and return. If name is
    None (the default) it is taken from context's `name` attribute. For
    details on how fields are parsed and how they resolve to the attribute
    value(s) of an object see `resolve_field`.

`default`
    Determines how to handle the case where the field cannot be resolved
    for an object which should be either SKIP or NONE. If SKIP then the
    spec will return NONE when the field cannot be resolved otherwise it is
    NONE and an AttributeError is raised.

fields.description:

always capture less than the hold amount (e.g. a partial capture).
Otherwise its the maximum per debit amount for your marketplace.

If the resolving URI references a hold then the default ``amount``
is the ``amount`` associated with that hold. Otherwise no default
is provided and this field is **required**.
fields.name: amount

fields.description:
Text that will appear on the buyer's statement. Characters that can be
used are limited to:

- ASCII letters (``a-z`` and ``A-Z``)
- Digits (``0-9``)
- Special characters (``.<>(){}[]+&!$;-%_?:#@~='" ^\`|``)

Any other characters will be rejected.

Debits - Truncated to 18 characters.
Credits - Truncated to 14 characters.

All Visa, Master Card, Discover, American Express debits will have a prefix of "BAL*"
e.g. "BAL*marketplace.com".

ACH debits and credits do not have a prefix.

American Express pending transactions will be shown as "BALANCED INC". AMEX
pending transactions are hidden by default in the American Express web portal.
Once the debit is settled it will convert to "BAL*<appears_on_statement_as>".
fields.name: appears_on_statement_as

fields.description:
Text that will appear on the buyer's statement. Characters that can be
used are limited to:

- ASCII letters (``a-z`` and ``A-Z``)
- Digits (``0-9``)
- Special characters (``.<>(){}[]+&!$;-%_?:#@~='" ^\`|``)

Any other characters will be rejected.

Debits - Truncated to 18 characters.
Credits - Truncated to 14 characters.

All Visa, Master Card, Discover, American Express debits will have a prefix of "BAL*"
e.g. "BAL*marketplace.com".

ACH debits and credits do not have a prefix.

American Express pending transactions will be shown as "BALANCED INC". AMEX
pending transactions are hidden by default in the American Express web portal.
Once the debit is settled it will convert to "BAL*<appears_on_statement_as>".
fields.name: appears_on_statement_as

fields.description:
A single level key-value structure where both key and value can only
be strings.

This example shows how to check if a key is in the field:

    {'e[contains]': 'universe'}

While this example shows how to check if a key in the field has a
particular value:

    {'e.rating': 'ultra-shady'}

And of course you can check many key, value pairs for a particular value:

    {'e.rating': 'ultra-shady',
     'e.street': 'band',
     }

particular value:

And of course you can check many key, value pairs for a particular value:

    {'e.rating': 'ultra-shady',
     'e.street': 'band',

fields.description:
Resolves a particular field of an object (e.g. o.some.random.field). It
will also check if this object is part is part of a cycle as indicated by
context's `cycle` attribute and what to do about it as indicated by
context's `cycle_default` attribute. If SKIP then the spec returns NONE
indicating the spec should be ignored otherwise a ValueError is raised.

`name`
    The name of the field to pull off the object and return. If name is
    None (the default) it is taken from context's `name` attribute. For
    details on how fields are parsed and how they resolve to the attribute
    value(s) of an object see `resolve_field`.

`default`
    Determines how to handle the case where the field cannot be resolved
    for an object which should be either SKIP or NONE. If SKIP then the
    spec will return NONE when the field cannot be resolved otherwise it is
    NONE and an AttributeError is raised.

will also check if this object is part is part of a cycle as indicated by
context's `cycle` attribute and what to do about it as indicated by
context's `cycle_default` attribute. If SKIP then the spec returns NONE
indicating the spec should be ignored otherwise a ValueError is raised.

`name`
    The name of the field to pull off the object and return. If name is
    None (the default) it is taken from context's `name` attribute. For
    details on how fields are parsed and how they resolve to the attribute
    value(s) of an object see `resolve_field`.

`default`
    Determines how to handle the case where the field cannot be resolved
    for an object which should be either SKIP or NONE. If SKIP then the
    spec will return NONE when the field cannot be resolved otherwise it is
    NONE and an AttributeError is raised.

fields.validate:
URI referencing the account of the merchant whom the debit is being
done on behalf of. This is different from marketplace. In a
peer-to-peer transaction, there are three parties:

1. Marketplace
2. Seller/Service provider
3. Buyer

This merchant account represents **2**.

:param field: Either on_behalf_of_uri and merchant_uri
:param obo: This is a merchant account on a marketplace
name: on_behalf_of_uri
merchant_uri

fields.description:
USD cents.
If the resolving URI references a hold then this is hold amount. You can
always capture less than the hold amount (e.g. a partial capture).
Otherwise its the maximum per debit amount for your marketplace.
fields.default:
If the resolving URI references a hold then the default ``amount``
is the ``amount`` associated with that hold. Otherwise no default
is provided and this field is **required**.
fields.name: amount

fields.description:
Text that will appear on the buyer's statement. Characters that can be
used are limited to:

- ASCII letters (``a-z`` and ``A-Z``)
- Digits (``0-9``)
- Special characters (``.<>(){}[]+&!$;-%_?:#@~='" ^\`|``)

Any other characters will be rejected.

Debits - Truncated to 18 characters.
Credits - Truncated to 14 characters.

All Visa, Master Card, Discover, American Express debits will have a prefix of "BAL*"
e.g. "BAL*marketplace.com".

ACH debits and credits do not have a prefix.

American Express pending transactions will be shown as "BALANCED INC". AMEX
pending transactions are hidden by default in the American Express web portal.
Once the debit is settled it will convert to "BAL*<appears_on_statement_as>".
fields.name: appears_on_statement_as

fields.description: Single level mapping from string keys to string values.
fields.name: meta

fields.default:
If the resolved URI references an ``account`` then it is used as
the default. If a ``hold`` or ``hold_uri`` field is present then the
``account`` associated with that hold is the default. Otherwise no
default is provided and this field is **required**.
name: account_uri
customer_uri

fields.description:

funding source is a card.
fields.default:

fields.description:
Text that will appear on the buyer's statement. Characters that can be
used are limited to:

- ASCII letters (``a-z`` and ``A-Z``)
- Digits (``0-9``)
- Special characters (``.<>(){}[]+&!$;-%_?:#@~='" ^\`|``)

Any other characters will be rejected.

Debits - Truncated to 18 characters.
Credits - Truncated to 14 characters.

All Visa, Master Card, Discover, American Express debits will have a prefix of "BAL*"
e.g. "BAL*marketplace.com".

ACH debits and credits do not have a prefix.

American Express pending transactions will be shown as "BALANCED INC". AMEX
pending transactions are hidden by default in the American Express web portal.
Once the debit is settled it will convert to "BAL*<appears_on_statement_as>".

fields.name: amount

fields.description:
Text that will appear on the buyer's statement. Characters that can be
used are limited to:

- ASCII letters (``a-z`` and ``A-Z``)
- Digits (``0-9``)
- Special characters (``.<>(){}[]+&!$;-%_?:#@~='" ^\`|``)

Any other characters will be rejected.

Debits - Truncated to 18 characters.
Credits - Truncated to 14 characters.

All Visa, Master Card, Discover, American Express debits will have a prefix of "BAL*"
e.g. "BAL*marketplace.com".

ACH debits and credits do not have a prefix.

American Express pending transactions will be shown as "BALANCED INC". AMEX
pending transactions are hidden by default in the American Express web portal.
Once the debit is settled it will convert to "BAL*<appears_on_statement_as>".
fields.name: appears_on_statement_as

fields.description:
A single level key-value structure where both key and value can only
be strings.

This example shows how to check if a key is in the field:

    {'e[contains]': 'universe'}

While this example shows how to check if a key in the field has a
particular value:

    {'e.rating': 'ultra-shady'}

And of course you can check many key, value pairs for a particular value:

    {'e.rating': 'ultra-shady',
     'e.street': 'band',
     }
